message.content:
If you want to play the violin more smoothly, here are some tips:

1. Hold your violin and bow correctly: The way that you hold both the instrument and bow is crucial for smooth playing. Make sure your posture is comfortable.

2. Bow technique: Straighten your wrist when drawing back on a down-bow stroke or forward on an up-bow stroke.

3. Keep fingers rounded: Avoid flattening them by keeping them comfortably rounded through each movement while maintaining control of pressure exerted upon strings during contact between hair of bow and string itself called "point-of-contact."

4. Stick to one musical idea at a time, something as simple as scales/chromatic runs before moving onto other complexities like chords/progressions from thereon outâ€”take breaks every 10 minutes so agility in hand/arm muscles don't suffer great strain over prolonged stretches where tension has tendency build-up overtime causing stiffness lacking flexibility; moreover aim practice sessions not exceed hours beyond limit within which body starts feel fatigue setting preventing finesse needed express yourself optimally well achieving sublime measure taking pridefully enjoying orchestral endeavour being unequivocal source expertise overall!
